title: The Hard Stuff! All About Bones
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 1,691 words, Level U (Grade 4), Lexile 910L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     R and X		                 
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     R and X		                 
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     R and X
description: What do humans have in common with snakes, elephants, and whales? A skeleton! The numbers of bones may vary, but the purpose is the same--to support and protect all of the organs inside the body. Photographs, illustrations, X-rays, and detailed diagrams of various bones help readers make meaningful connections with the text. Book and lesson also available at levels R and X.
highFrequencyWords: appendages, ball-and-socket joint, bone marrow, cartilage, fused, hinged joints, legumes, ligaments, precise, spinal cord, sutures, swivel joints, tendons, vertebrates
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
awareness: Multiple Meaning Words                : Identify and use multiple-meaning words
